com.absio.crypto.cipher

Class CipherHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.crypto.cipher.CipherHelper

  • public class CipherHelper
extends Object
    Use this helper class to assist with cipher key and encryption operations. It uses the JCE Cipher class to accomplish most of these operations. The helper works with a set CipherTransformation which is defined at creation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CipherHelper()
      Creates a helper with CipherTransformation.DEFAULT as the transformation.
      CipherHelper(CipherTransformation transformation)
      Create a helper with the given transformation.

      This will decrypt the ciphertext using the given key and iv.
      EncryptionResults encrypt(byte[] plaintext)
      This will encrypt the plaintext using the given key and iv.
      byte[] encrypt(byte[] key, byte[] iv, byte[] plaintext)
      This will encrypt the plaintext using the given key and iv.
      byte[] generateIV()
      Using the block size of the cipher and the mode of the transformation this will generate an initialization vector.
      byte[] generateKey()
      This will generate a symmetric key using AESKeyStrength.DEFAULT for determining the size.
      byte[] generateKey(AESKeyStrength keyStrength)
      This will generate a symmetric key using the given AESKeyStrength for determining the size.
      byte[] generateKey(int keySize)
      This will generate a symmetric key of the given size using the algorithm of the helper's defined CipherTransformation.

      • CipherHelper

        public CipherHelper()
             throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                    NoSuchPaddingException
        Creates a helper with CipherTransformation.DEFAULT as the transformation.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the algorithm in the transformation is not supported
        NoSuchPaddingException - thrown if the padding in the transformation is not supported

      • CipherHelper

        public CipherHelper(CipherTransformation transformation)
             throws NoSuchPaddingException,
                    NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Create a helper with the given transformation.
        Parameters:
        transformation - the transformation to use in this helper
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the algorithm in the transformation is not supported
        NoSuchPaddingException - thrown if the padding in the transformation is not supported

    • Method Detail

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(byte[] key,
                      byte[] iv,
                      byte[] ciphertext)
               throws BadPaddingException,
                      IllegalBlockSizeException,
                      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                      InvalidKeyException
        This will decrypt the ciphertext using the given key and iv. The Cipher created using the information from the CipherTransformation is used for the decryption.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use for decrypting the data
        iv - the iv to use for decrypting the data
        ciphertext - the data to decrypt
        Returns:
        the decrypted data
        Throws:
        BadPaddingException - thrown if the padding in the transformation is not supported
        IllegalBlockSizeException - thrown if the block size in the transformation is not supported
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - thrown if the algorithm in the transformation is not supported
        InvalidKeyException - thrown if the key is not valid

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt(byte[] key,
                      byte[] iv,
                      byte[] plaintext)
               throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                      InvalidKeyException,
                      BadPaddingException,
                      IllegalBlockSizeException
        This will encrypt the plaintext using the given key and iv. The Cipher created using the information from the CipherTransformation is used for the encryption.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use for encrypting the data
        iv - the iv to use for encrypting the data
        plaintext - the data to encrypt
        Returns:
        the encrypted data
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - thrown if the algorithm in the transformation is not supported
        InvalidKeyException - thrown if the key is not valid
        BadPaddingException - thrown if the padding in the transformation is not supported
        IllegalBlockSizeException - thrown if the block size in the transformation is not supported

      • encrypt

        public EncryptionResults encrypt(byte[] plaintext)
                          throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                 InvalidKeyException,
                                 BadPaddingException,
                                 IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                 NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This will encrypt the plaintext using the given key and iv. The Cipher created using the information from the CipherTransformation is used for the encryption.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - the data to encrypt
        Returns:
        the encryption results
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - thrown if the algorithm in the transformation is not supported
        InvalidKeyException - thrown if the key is not valid
        BadPaddingException - thrown if the padding in the transformation is not supported
        IllegalBlockSizeException - thrown if the block size in the transformation is not supported
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the algorithm of the transformation is not supported

      • generateIV

        public byte[] generateIV()
        Using the block size of the cipher and the mode of the transformation this will generate an initialization vector. For CTR mode, a counter initialization vector is created. Otherwise the initialization vector will be random bytes (the block size long).
        Returns:
        the initialization vector

      • generateKey

        public byte[] generateKey()
                   throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This will generate a symmetric key using AESKeyStrength.DEFAULT for determining the size.

        Note: this will only work if the helper's transformation has an algorithm of AES.

        Returns:
        the generated symmetric key
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the algorithm of the transformation is not supported

      • generateKey

        public byte[] generateKey(int keySize)
                   throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This will generate a symmetric key of the given size using the algorithm of the helper's defined CipherTransformation.
        Parameters:
        keySize - the symmetric key size in bits
        Returns:
        the generated symmetric key
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the algorithm of the transformation is not supported

      • generateKey

        public byte[] generateKey(AESKeyStrength keyStrength)
                   throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This will generate a symmetric key using the given AESKeyStrength for determining the size.

        Note: this will only work if the helper's transformation has an algorithm of AES.

        Parameters:
        keyStrength - the AESKeyStrength to use when generating the key - used to get the key size in bits
        Returns:
        the generated symmetric key
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the algorithm of the transformation is not supported
